content: I'm talking with Brian Ollendyke about a possible session on Backdrop CMS and HAX.

I added the host name to each session:
Backdrop_CMS_Live__.png

I just had a discussion over the phone with a person that recently registered in localize.b.org. They are a two-man digital agency in Southern Greece, and he's be keeping an eye on Backdrop for a year now. He said nice things about us :smile: ...I asked about the Greek Drupal community and am thinking to attempt to approach them, in order to have a session in Greek ...the only problem I see is that with the financial crisis in Greece, the $20 donation/registration may be an issue (as ridiculous as this may seem, please note that the average monthly income in Greece is about 700-800euro/month or less).
That is a common to high wage in much of Latin America, as well.
...anyway, I'm not good at organizing events, and being unsocial by choice (no facebook twitter etc.) doesn't help. Let's see if I end up having the energy/drive to get this done.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) yeah ...the Aussie in me thought that the $20USD is not much, but the Greek in me did have reservations. It might be key to people not registering unfortunately.

the only problem I see is that with the financial crisis in Greece, the $20 donation/registration may be an issue (as ridiculous as this may seem, please note that the average monthly income in Greece is about 700-800euro/month or less)

I understand this and share this concern. I'm also chatting with some folks in Bangladesh, where the cost is also an issue. The $20 is a suggested donation and the intent is that no one should be prevented from participating. Having said that, I'm not sure we have made this easy enough.

I would suggest that we create a special discount code (free) that we can offer to folks in this situation. I think that if someone had a code, they might feel better about registering.
Note: We have 13 registrations so far. Only one has donated less than $20 and 2 have donated more than $20.
Yup. Free coupon sounds like a good idea :+1:

I added "Testing One, Two, Three" as a pre-conference session when folks can test out their equipment and ask questions. Any feedback on this?
https://backdrop-live.backdropcms.org/session/testing-one-two-three

Any feedback on this?

Some suggestions:

  • Put "We are using Zoom for the conference" part in the beginning.
  • Say what "Zoom" means, e.g. "We are using Zoom videoconference rooms".
  • Clarify if people can just use their browser or need a Zoom app.

(And, strangely, the value for the Berlin time zone is missing.)
@jenlampton - I think we discussed avoiding the term session, but I'm just realizing how much I've been using that term, mostly out of habit and because it's easy for folks to understand.

The problem is that since it's "easy for folks to understand" that means
they don't know what's actually happening.

If we can switch to "discussion" that will be more honest.

I'm changing the terminology as I review things. While, I keep falling back to the term session, we do make it clear in many places that these are mostly discussions/conversations. The schedule has always listed the format for every topic to be a discussion or a presentation with a discussion.

Backdrop_LIVE__.png
